data.title: Hetzner servers no longer auto-update.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Attempting a new release while this is broken would likely fracture our playerbase, with many people staying with the current release so that they can use the dedicated servers.

Pinging @xaionaro: This is the biggest (and hopefully last) remaining blocker for our next release.

An alternative could be to spin up some new servers to cover the slack until this is fixed.

data.title: Better Medic AI.
data.body: It would be nice if the medic would not run up, and stand next to, the current target if they were selected when choosing said target. In one of the Tiberian Sun patches the Medic would auto heal nearby injured infantry and not run twords the enemy.

data.title: Attempt to parse unexpected key events as text.
data.body: Fixes #4232. Hotkeys still can't be bound to these foreign keys, but the fix there is less clear (SDL2 doesn't define a specific code to map them to).

data.body: Fixes #4278.

data.title: Fix death count in observer stats
data.body: Yes, I derbed here. Reported in #4283.

data.title: Rewrite shroud renderer.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
This enables the original shroud artwork in C&C and D2K, and makes the shroud edges a bit smoother by using all four transition levels and varying the opacity instead of splitting into two and two. It should be forward compatible with isometric terrain for TS.

Performance is slightly faster at updating the shroud state, but potentially slightly slower at rendering (it now draws all visible tiles instead of aggregating shrouded rows). Significant perf fixes were considered outside the scope of this patch.

Fixes #2162, #3024, #4034.

![shroud_cnc](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/1722147/14382fe8-623b-11e3-9206-9b0dcea245fc.png)
![shroud_d2k](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/1722148/143aa106-623b-11e3-9223-13250688d7b6.png)

data.title: Fix cnc's nuke not damaging air units (a regression from a recent commit...
data.body: ... to remove its PerCell damage model)

data.title: Special characters as hotkey in YAML-files produces crash!
data.body:
Version: Latest Playtest 20131209
Last working version: 20130915 release
Mod: RA

If you enter a special charakter (such as \ or *) as hotkey in a YAML-file (like structures.yaml), the game will crash immediately right at the start.
Only normal letters work.

Special characters worked fine in 20130915, it has probably something to do with the altered hotkey handling (they are handled as hotkey-struct instead of simple strings).

It would be important to have special characters back, as this makes sense on many foreign keyboard-layouts and people are used to their custom keys now for a long time.

Oh, and not even their keycode-enums such as 'BACKSLASH' work in this case.

Exeption.log is:

Red Alert Mod at Version playtest-20131209
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5420
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: FieldLoader: Cannot parse `/` into `Hotkey.OpenRA.Hotkey` 
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FieldLoader.<InvalidValueAction>m__1C(String s, Type t, String f)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FieldLoader.GetValue(String fieldName, Type fieldType, String value, MemberInfo field)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FieldLoader.TryGetValueFromYaml(FieldInfo field, MiniYaml yaml, Object& ret)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.FieldLoader.Load(Object self, MiniYaml my)
   at OpenRA.ActorInfo.LoadTraitInfo(String traitName, MiniYaml my)
   at OpenRA.ActorInfo..ctor(String name, MiniYaml node, Dictionary`2 allUnits)
   at OpenRA.Rules.<LoadRules>m__32(MiniYamlNode k, Dictionary`2 y)
   at OpenRA.Rules.<LoadYamlRules>c__AnonStorey2A`1.<>m__3B(MiniYamlNode kv)
   at OpenRA.Exts.ToDictionaryWithConflictLog[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, String debugName, Func`2 logKey, Func`2 logValue)
   at OpenRA.Rules.LoadYamlRules[T](String[] files, List`1 dict, Func`3 f)
   at OpenRA.Rules.LoadRules(Manifest m, Map map)
   at OpenRA.ModData.PrepareMap(String uid)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, Boolean isShellmap)
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap()
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.DefaultLoadScreen.TestAndContinue()
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.DefaultLoadScreen.StartGame()
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeWithMod(String mod)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: Units moving to already destroyed building in shroud
data.body:
Version: 20130915
Mod: RA

Imagine one of your teammates destroys a building which is covered by FoW.
As it is now, that building still remains visible to you.
Now, if you got a bunch of units and order em to attack that bulding, they will MOVE to it's location instead (as there is nothing to attack anymore), and so they will move to their certain death right into the enemy's defenses, many times.

This is not a desirable behaviour and should be changed.

My advise is, prefer playability over realism in this case.
(Many things in this game already follow this rule, a rifleman taking 10 bazooka-hits from a rocketman for example, which makes sense from a gameplay point of view but is not exactly realistic. But it's good the way it is!)

So, just make destroyed buildings disappear, so you know whats going on.

The exploration aspect is already very accentuated as you have to scout for new buildings, enemy units and as your units cannot shoot at what is not visible to them.

Also, even from a realism-point of view it's a 50/50 case:
Yes, if your units cannot see the building, they dont know if it is really destroyed.
On the other hand, they can hear (and perhaps even see) the explosion... the player sure can hear it.

The only "realistic" (for the other 50%) solution i could think of:
Units would endlessly continue firing at the building (assuming they dont know if it still exists), and you always would have to scout for every little peanuts.
That would be annoying as hell.
As units moving to their death is now.

Solution: Just remove destroyed buildings from the map and we're fine.  :)

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1351937-units-moving-to-already-destroyed-building-in-shroud?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Wrong death counts in statistics
data.body:
Version: Latest official (20130915)
Mod: RA

After a battle, i had a look at statistics.
Under "basic", it said:
"Deaths: 252".

But in "combat", it said:
"Units lost: 126" and "Bldg lost: 12".

That would make 138 and not 252.

This is probably related to husks.

It just jumps back

data.title: Dune 2000 MAP format support
data.body:
@ew07002 already wrote an http://old.d2kplus.com/wiki/index.php?title=Map_Files importer, but only published screenshots and then quickly vanished. http://forum.dune2k.com/topic/24184-opend2k-cross-platform-reimplementation-of-dune-2000/?p=375070 The problem is that Dune 2000 uses a 1x1 format. There are no pre-fabricated templates as in RA95 or C&C Gold and there has never been an official map editor. The fan made ones workaround this by defining their own set of templates, because it would otherwise be very annoying to make maps cell by cell. However these sets might conflict with the choices I made for our combined ARRAKIS tileset. Making deeper changes to arrakis.yaml will break the existing few maps we have. The easiest way would be to create BLOXBASE/BLOXBAT/BLOXWAST etc. legacy tilesets with bad usability in OpenRA.Editor.exe creating some ugly redundancy. Someone at http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=16009 also simply recreated the few popular Dune 2000 multiplayer maps manually.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1351517-dune-2000-map-format-support?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Dune 2000 MIS file import
data.body:
Wished at http://forum.dune2k.com/topic/24184-opend2k-cross-platform-reimplementation-of-dune-2000/page-13#entry385338 I suggest to create some kind of legacy file import which parses the MIS file and then places some pre-fabricated trigger functions into the map.lua file. Reverse engineered documentation is available at http://d2kplus.com/wiki/index.php?title=Mission_Files
## <bountysource-plugin>

Ore regen bug

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: Cells don't gradually regenerate with ore anymore but instead go immediately to the full ore state. You can have an entire ore patch fully replenish within a couple of minutes after nuking it.
